;周二晚上，飓风莉迪亚以 4 级风暴的形式袭击了墨西哥太平洋沿岸的拉斯佩尼塔斯海滩小镇，当地旅游胜地都在躲避暴雨、可能致命的大风和洪水。

;

;美国国家飓风中心 (NHC) 表示，莉迪亚的强度“极其危险”，最大持续风力可达 140 英里哈利斯科州每小时（225 公里/小时）。

;

;“我敦促居住在纳亚里特州和哈利斯科州之间的人们，特别是巴伊亚德班德拉斯、巴亚尔塔港和托马特兰的人们采取预防措施，”总统安德烈斯·曼努埃尔·洛佩兹·奥夫拉多尔在社交媒体平台 X 上表示，建议人们远离低洼地区、河流和斜坡。

;

;总部位于迈阿密的 NHC 表示，莉迪亚正在以 16 英里/小时（26 公里/小时）的速度向东北偏东移动，应该随着飓风向内陆移动，风力迅速减弱。

;

;在附近的主要旅游目的地巴亚尔塔港，机场宣布关闭至周三上午 8 点。

;

;飓风警告从玛丽亚岛到纳亚里特州的内陆城镇埃尔罗布利托，再到港口城市曼萨尼约，而热带风暴条件可能会延伸到米却肯州和锡那罗亚州南部地区。

;

;Lidia预计将在NHC 表示，降雨量为 4-8 英寸（10-20 厘米），但部分地区周三降雨量可能高达 12 英寸。

;

;在更南边，最大热带风暴造成两人死亡、至少两人受伤据当地媒体报道，格雷罗州暴雨过后。

;控制美国众议院的共和党人周二听取了著名党员史蒂夫·斯卡利斯 (Steve Scalise) 和吉姆·乔丹 (Jim Jordan) 的发言，他们是在中东战争和另一次迫在眉睫的政府关门带来的越来越大的压力下，争夺议长的强大角色。

;

;退出闭门论坛的议员们表示，众议院多数党领袖斯卡利斯和乔丹都没有，当共和党人周三开始以无记名投票方式投票选出提名人时，担任司法委员会主席的他将拥有明显的优势。

;

;“我们党内有两位优秀的领导人，他们对未来的发展方向有着良好的看法。共和党需要离开，需要理解并强调重新团结党，”众议员迈克·加西亚告诉记者。

;

;但在周三投票给候选人之前，共和党人必须决定是否要结束内部分歧要求任何被提名人赢得 217 张共和党选票，足以压倒民主党的反对票选出下一位众议院议长。目前的规则只需要简单多数。

;

;“首要任务是找出适合会议的规则变更，”众议员凯特·卡马克 (Kat Cammack) 说。

;

;共和党人的支持率很窄。众议院以 221 比 212 占多数。

;

;核心小组的微弱分歧引发了一些担忧，即两位候选人都无法在第一轮投票中赢得足够的支持来当选议长。

;

; “我们明天就去完成这件事，众议院将重新开始工作，”斯卡利斯在两个多小时的候选人论坛结束后告诉记者。

;

;斯卡利斯和乔丹各自承诺立法者表示，支持最终成为提名人的候选人。

;

;共和党在众议院的微弱多数使得他们的一小部分成员有可能迫使上周被罢免议长职务的凯文·麦卡锡(Kevin McCarthy)忍受15 场艰苦的全场投票才能成为 1 月份的议长。

;

;“我们需要在核心小组内部处理这个问题，而不是重复我们 1 月份所做的事情，”当时反对麦卡锡的众议员拉尔夫·诺曼 (Ralph Norman) 说。< /p>;

;麦卡锡周一表示，他将;如果众议院共和党人要求的话，收回这个职位;，但周二告诉记者，“我请他们不要提名我。”

;

;只花了八名共和党人上周推翻麦卡锡，这可能会让领导核心小组对任何新发言人来说都是一个挑战。虽然麦卡锡是第一位在正式投票中被赶下台的议长，但前两位担任该职位的共和党人在党内强硬派的压力下离开了。

;

;共和党人可能必须解决其他棘手问题，包括如何前进讨论的议题包括政府为 10 月 1 日开始的财政年度提供资金，以及是否改变只允许一名议员投票罢免麦卡锡的规则。目前的政府资金将于 11 月 17 日到期。

;

;前总统唐纳德·特朗普支持的著名强硬保守派乔丹在周二的论坛上表示，他将支持一项新的权宜之计措施，为政府提供资金到 4 月，以避免部分资金短缺。约旦支持者托马斯·马西众议员表示，政府关闭。

;

;其他立法者表示，斯卡利斯也支持一项临时资助措施，但他们提供的细节很少。

;

;斯卡利斯似乎得到了支持包括政党领导人在内的许多资深共和党人和建制派共和党人的支持，而乔丹则得到了包括特朗普式民粹主义者在内的其他人的支持。

;

;担任临时议长的众议员帕特里克·麦克亨利被视为可能的后备候选人，如果没有其他人赢得足够的选票。但麦克亨利周二告诉记者，他尚未与同事谈论竞选事宜，并补充说有两名候选人。

;

;在选出新议长之前，众议院无法采取行动。在巴勒斯坦武装组织哈马斯发动袭击后，以色列周日宣战，这给共和党带来了新的压力。 -2023-10-09/">;立即呼吁;要求美国提供更多军事援助。一些共和党人希望最早在周四就有一位新发言人。

;;周二（10 月 10 日），数百名示威者在布达佩斯多瑙河沿岸点燃蜡烛，声援以色列，此前周末哈马斯发动了史无前例的袭击，造成 1,000 多名以色列人死亡。;
;;
;;以色列紧急救援人员在2023 年 10 月 10 日，一枚从加沙地带发射到以色列的火箭落在以色列南部阿什凯隆，一栋受损建筑的窗户。REUTERS/Ronen Zvulun;
;

;以色列誓言要升级其应对措施巴勒斯坦激进组织哈马斯发动地面进攻，而美国总统乔·拜登承诺支持以色列;以色列历史上最致命的巴勒斯坦激进分子袭击;。

;

;以色列的驻华盛顿大使馆周二表示，周末哈马斯袭击造成的死亡人数已超过 1,000 人。公共广播公司 Kan 报道称，这一数字已达到 1,200 人。

;

;受害者绝大多数是被枪杀的平民;在家中;、街道上或户外舞会上。数十名以色列人和其他海外人士;被抓获;并被带到加沙作为人质，社交媒体上显示一些人被游街示众。

;

;哈马斯武装分子周一扣押以色列士兵和平民作为人质，威胁要处决一名以色列人。加沙的每一栋房屋都在没有警告的情况下遭到袭击，但随着周二夜幕降临，没有迹象表明他们这样做了。

;

;以色列国防部长约夫·加兰特在加沙围栏附近对士兵说：“哈马斯想要改变，它就会得到改变。加沙的情况将不再存在。”

;

;“我们从空中开始进攻，稍后我们也会从地面进攻。我们一直在控制以色列从第二天起就开始进攻该地区，而且只会愈演愈烈。”

;

;以色列在占领加沙 38 年后于 2005 年从加沙撤军，并自哈马斯 2007 年夺取加沙政权以来一直对其实施封锁。 2007 年。周一宣布的围困将阻止食物和燃料的进入。

;

;三名安全消息人士称，在以色列北部边境，从黎巴嫩南部向以色列发射了一连串火箭弹，引发了以色列的炮击。

;

;更多;炮弹发射军方表示，来自叙利亚领土的导弹;降落在以色列的空旷地区，促使以色列进行还击，这进一步引发了人们对暴力可能导致更广泛战争的担忧。

;

;在白宫，拜登告诉记者，美国“加强了我们在该地区的军事力量态势，以加强我们的威慑力”，包括采取;航母战斗群;和战斗机。

;

;“我们随时准备根据需要调动更多资产，”拜登说。拜登说：“让我再次对任何国家、任何组织、任何想利用这一局势的人说，我有一个词：不要。”这显然是指伊朗及其在该地区的代理人。

;

;美国官员表示，他们没有证据表明伊朗策划了这些袭击，但指出伊朗长期支持哈马斯。

;

;拜登称哈马斯袭击;“纯粹的邪恶行为;”，并表示华盛顿正在紧急向以色列提供更多军事援助，包括弹药和拦截器，以补充铁穹防空系统。他呼吁以色列在回应中遵循“战争法”。

;

;拜登还派了高级外交官安东尼·布林肯前往以色列，布林肯将于周三前往该地区并与以色列会面美国国务院发言人马修·米勒表示，以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡的右翼联盟和反对派领导人与以色列官员关系密切，;组建紧急联合政府;。

;

;内塔尼亚胡和内塔尼亚胡之间的会议前国防部长本尼·甘茨原定于周二出席，但被推迟到周三。

;

;以色列军方表示，其部队在直升机和无人机的支持下，于周二晚些时候在以色列境内与武装分子发生冲突。

;<在阿什凯隆发生的事件中，士兵们在距离加沙地带仅 10 公里（6 英里）多一点的石油码头附近的工业区起火，打死了三名武装分子，该码头已被烧毁;袭击发生后关闭;，它说。

;

;以色列飞机军方称，一夜之间袭击了加沙市达拉杰图法地区的 70 多个目标，哈马斯曾利用该地区进行直接袭击。

;

;哈马斯附属媒体称，袭击袭击了加沙市和南部地区的房屋。汗尤尼斯市。

;

;据一名医疗官员称，加沙市萨布拉社区的一所房屋遭到袭击，造成五人死亡。

;

;在社交媒体上呼吁帮助的居民表示，许多建筑物都被炸毁。坍塌，有时多达 50 人被困在里面，救援人员无法到达他们。

;

;联合国表示，超过 18 万加沙人无家可归，许多人挤在街道或学校里。

;

;周二，在加沙汗尤尼斯医院的太平间，担架上躺着尸体，尸体腹部写着名字。医务人员呼吁亲属尽快收拾尸体，因为没有更多空间容纳死者。

;

;一栋用作紧急避难所的市政大楼遭到袭击。那里的幸存者谈到许多人死亡。

;

;";加沙没有一个地方是安全的;，正如你所看到的，他们袭击了所有地方，”35 岁的阿拉·阿布·泰尔 (Ala Abu Tair) 说，他在逃离边境附近的阿巴桑·卡比拉 (Abassan Al-Kabira) 后与家人一起在那里寻求庇护.

;

;哈马斯官员称，哈马斯政治办公室的两名成员贾瓦德·阿布·沙马拉 (Jawad Abu Shammala) 和扎卡里亚·阿布·马马尔 (Zakaria Abu Maamar) 在汗尤尼斯的一次空袭中丧生。

;

;他们是第一批遇难者。自以色列开始袭击该飞地以来，哈马斯高级成员被杀。以色列表示，阿布·沙马拉领导了一系列针对以色列平民的行动。

;

;巴勒斯坦外交部表示，自周六以来，以色列的空袭摧毁了超过 22,600 个住宅单位和 10 个医疗设施，并损坏了 48 所学校。

;

;联合国人权事务高级专员;沃尔克·特克< /a>; 谴责哈马斯的袭击，他说：“国际人道法很明确：在整个袭击过程中，始终保持注意保护平民和民用物体免遭伤害的义务仍然适用。”

;

;暴力事件也随之爆发。在被占领的约旦河西岸和东耶路撒冷，以色列警方表示，周二晚上，他们杀死了两名向警察发射烟花的巴勒斯坦人。

;

;在约旦河西岸，以色列警方在与以色列的冲突中造成 21 名巴勒斯坦人死亡、130 人受伤。据巴勒斯坦卫生部称，以色列军队自周六起开始行动。

;The strength of Lidia's winds, however, are expected to weaken rapidly after it moves inland.

; Wed, 11 Oct 2023 07:25:04 +0800 N. Carolina Republicans enact voting changes ahead of 2024, prompting Democrats to suehttps://reuters.com/article/usa-election-north-carolina-restrictions/n-carolina-republicans-enact-voting-changes-ahead-of-2024-prompting-democrats-to-sue-idUSKBN31A1Z7
;;2023-10-10T22:36:47Z;
;;
;;North Carolina's Legislative Building seen in Raleigh, North Carolina, US on December 19, 2016. REUTERS/Jonathan Drake/File Photo;
;

;North Carolina Republicans on Tuesday pushed through new curbs on same-day voter registration by overriding a gubernatorial veto, prompting immediate lawsuits by Democratic and progressive groups to halt the changes.

;

;The new law requires additional identification and throws out the ballots of same-day registrants whose mail comes back as undeliverable, making it harder to register during an early voting period. It was enacted by the state legislature's Republican supermajority after a veto by Democratic Governor Roy Cooper.

;

;The longstanding fight over such measures underscores the impact of even a small number of votes in North Carolina, which despite a Republican legislative majority swings between both major parties in presidential elections. The state is expected to be a battleground in the 2024 White House race.

;

;Democrats said the election law amounted to voter suppression that would particularly hurt certain groups including voters of color.

;

;Republicans, echoing members of their party who have implemented voting restrictions across the country, insisted it will make elections more secure. They accused Democrats of misleading voters and engaging in hyperbolic rhetoric in their opposition.

;

;"These are commonsense reforms that restore faith in our elections," Republican state senators Warren Daniel and Paul Newton said in a joint statement after the override.

;

;Cooper accused Republicans of orchestrating a power grab.

;

;"Republican efforts to change the voting laws have nothing to do with election security and everything to do with manipulating elections to entrench their power," Cooper said in a statement.

;

;"Every single eligible voter deserves fair access to the ballot box and to have their vote count, and North Carolinians will not stand for this voter suppression."

;

;Moments after the vote to override Cooper's veto, the Democratic National Committee and the North Carolina Democratic Party filed a lawsuit challenging the measure, the groups said.

;

;In a statement, they called it a "wide-ranging voter suppression law that will restrict access to early voting across the state, and make it harder to vote - particularly for voters of color, older voters and young voters."

;

;Another lawsuit, filed on behalf of the groups Voto Latino, the Watauga County Voting Rights Task Force and Down Home North Carolina, asks the court to halt the provision of the law that invalidates ballots if a single piece of undeliverable mail is returned by the post office on the day before an election.

; Wed, 11 Oct 2023 06:55:04 +0800 Elijah McClain: trial nears end for Colorado officers charged in Black man“s deathhttps://reuters.com/article/usa-race-colorado/colorado-prosecutor-says-officers-accused-in-elijah-mcclain-death-chose-to-see-violence-defense-says-others-to-blame-idUSKBN31A0LE
;;2023-10-10T22:50:29Z;
;;
;;Protesters gather for a rally to call for justice for Elijah McClain in Denver, Colorado, US, November 21, 2020. REUTERS/Kevin Mohatt/File Photo;
;

;A Colorado prosecutor on Tuesday told jurors that two officers charged with manslaughter in the killing of Elijah McClain repeatedly and ;unreasonably assaulted; the young Black man who died after a police stop in 2019.

;

;Defense attorneys, though, said others were to blame, including medical responders and even McClain himself.

;

;Prosecutor Duane Lyons told jurors in his closing argument the officers made no attempt to moderate their encounter with McClain as their training dictated. Officers Randy Roedema and Jason Rosenblatt are charged with reckless manslaughter and second-degree assault. The state attorney general's office appointed Lyons after a local prosecutor declined to prosecute.

;

;"They chose to see violence where there was none," Lyons said. "They chose to use violence instead of de-escalating."

;

;Lyons showed the jurors body camera footage of the "repeated assaults" police inflicted on ;McClain, 23;.

;

;"To say this is just a tragedy would be to trivialize what happened that evening," Lyons added. "The defendants are guilty of crimes."

;

;But Don Sisson, a defense attorney for Roedema, in his closing argument portrayed McClain, who weighed 140 pounds, as violently resisting the police, saying that justified their response. He said that McClain was still alive and responsive when the officers handed control of him off to paramedics, and that the medics were solely responsible for injecting the ;fatal dose of ketamine;.

;

;"Just because there's a tragedy does not mean there's criminality," Sisson told jurors. "You cannot use your emotion to guide your decision."

;

;In the first of three trials in the McClain case, prosecutors have argued that officers Roedema and Rosenblatt unnecessarily brutalized McClain when they stopped him and that they gave false and incomplete information to paramedics which contributed to the medical workers administering a large dose of the sedative ketamine.

;

;Defense attorneys argued it was the ketamine that killed McClain, and that paramedics were solely responsible.

;

;A revised autopsy report in September 2022 concluded McClain died from "complications of ketamine administration following forcible restraint."

;

;A bystander had called 911 to report that McClain was acting suspiciously as he walked home from a convenience store on Aug. 24, 2019, in the Denver suburb of Aurora. McClain, dressed in a winter coat and face mask on a warm night, was listening to music using ear buds and dancing slightly as he walked, security videos showed.

;

;Rosenblatt, Roedema and a third Aurora police officer arrived and grabbed McClain nine seconds after confronting him, according to body camera footage showed by prosecutors. A struggle ensued.

;

;The footage does not show McClain grabbing for a gun, but Roedema can be heard yelling that McClain tried to get Rosenblatt's weapon. Harvey Steinberg, Rosenblatt's defense attorney, said during closing arguments that it was reasonable for his client to act on that warning. Prosecutors say McClain did not grab for a gun.

;

;The officers put McClain in a "carotid" chokehold at least twice and held him down for 15 minutes until medics arrived.

;

;The episode initially received little media attention, but the case gained more notice following the May 2020 killing of George Floyd, a Black man who died at the hands of Minneapolis police. Floyd's death sparked international outrage and fueled protests against racial injustice and police brutality.

;

;The joint trial for Roedema and Rosenblatt opened on Sept. 20. Roedema was suspended from the Aurora police pending the outcome of the case, while Rosenblatt was dismissed.

;

;The manslaughter trial for the third officer, Nathan Woodyard, is set to open on Friday. Two paramedics are expected to face trial next month.

;

;The pathologist who conducted McClain's autopsy, who was among medical and security expert witnesses called, testified that he could not say with certainty if the police chokehold and restraint of McClain contributed to his death.

;

;Defense attorneys rested their case without calling any witnesses. The defendants did not take the stand.

; Wed, 11 Oct 2023 06:25:03 +0800 Israel prepares ground offensive; Biden pledges support after Hamas attackshttps://reuters.com/article/israel-palestinians/israel-prepares-ground-offensive-biden-pledges-support-after-hamas-attacks-idUSKBN31A1WT
;;2023-10-10T21:34:32Z;
;

;Israel vowed to escalate its response to an attack by the Palestinian militant group Hamas with a ground offensive, while US President Joe Biden pledged support for Israel ;and issued a warning to anyone; who might seek to take advantage of the situation.

;

;Israeli air strikes razed entire districts and filled morgues with dead Palestinians on Tuesday, while across the barrier wall enclosing the coastal enclave, Israeli soldiers collected the last of Israel's dead.

;

;On Saturday, Hamas gunmen from the Gaza Strip rampaged through parts of southern Israel, killing hundreds of people in the ;deadliest Palestinian militant attack in Israel's history;.

;

;Israel's embassy in Washington said the death toll from the weekend Hamas attacks had surpassed 1,000.受害者绝大多数是平民，他们在家中、街道上或户外舞会上被枪杀。 Scores of Israelis and others from abroad were captured and taken to Gaza as hostages, some shown on social media being paraded through the streets.

;

;Gaza's health ministry said Israel's retaliatory air strikes had killed at least 900 people and wounded 4,600 up to Tuesday.

;

;Hamas militants holding Israeli soldiers and civilians hostage on Monday threatened to execute a captive for each home in Gaza hit without warning, but as night fell on Tuesday there was no indication they had done so.

;

;Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant, speaking to soldiers near the Gaza fence, said: "Hamas wanted a change and it will get one. What was in Gaza will no longer be."

;

;"We started the offensive from the air, later on we will also come from the ground. We've been controlling the area since Day 2 and we are on the offensive. It will only intensify."

;

;Israel withdrew troops from Gaza in 2005 after 38 years of occupation, and has kept it under blockade since Hamas seized power there in 2007. The siege it announced on Monday would keep out food and fuel.

;

;On Israel's northern border, a salvo of rockets was fired from southern Lebanon towards Israel, prompting Israeli shelling in return, three security sources said.

;

;More ;shells launched from Syrian territory; landed in open areas in Israel, prompting Israel to return fire, the military said, further raising fears that the violence could lead to a wider war.

;

;At the White House, Biden told reporters the United States had "enhanced our military force posture in the region to strengthen our deterrence," including by moving ;an aircraft carrier strike group; and fighter aircraft.

;

;"We stand ready to move in additional assets as needed," Biden said. "Let me say again to any country, any organization, anyone thinking of taking advantage of the situation, I have one word: don't," said Biden, in an apparent reference to Iran and its proxies in the region.

;

;US officials say they do not have evidence Iran orchestrated the attacks, but point to Iran's longterm support for Hamas.

;

;Biden called the Hamas attacks ;"an act of sheer evil;" and said Washington was rushing additional military assistance to Israel, including ammunition and interceptors to replenish the Iron Dome aerial defense system. He called for Israel to follow the "law of war" in its response.

;

;Biden also despatched his top diplomat Antony Blinken to Israel, who will depart for the region on Wednesday and meet with Israeli officials to deliver "a message of solidarity and support," State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said.

;

;Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's right wing coalition and opposition leaders were close to ;forming an emergency unity government; in the face of the biggest security emergency Israel has faced in decades.

;

;A meeting between Netanyahu and former Defence Minister Benny Gantz was scheduled for Tuesday but was delayed to Wednesday.

;

;The United Nations said more than 180,000 Gazans had been made homeless, many huddling on streets or in schools.

;

;At the morgue in Gaza's Khan Younis hospital, bodies lay on the ground on stretchers with names written on their bellies.医务人员呼吁亲属尽快收拾尸体，因为没有更多空间容纳死者。

;

;一栋用作紧急避难所的市政大楼遭到袭击。 Survivors there spoke of many dead.

;

;";No place is safe in Gaza;, as you see they hit everywhere," said Ala Abu Tair, 35, who had sought shelter there with his family after fleeing Abassan Al-Kabira near the border.

;

;Two members of Hamas' political office, Jawad Abu Shammala and Zakaria Abu Maamar, were killed in an air strike in Khan Younis, a Hamas official said.

;

;

;The rapid spread of misleading claims and doctored images in the aftermath of a deadly rampage by Hamas gunmen in Israel has put the focus on Elon Musk's X platform, which has drawn the ire of the European Union.

;

;Part of the challenge for those combating fake information online is that changes made by Musk earlier this year have made it more difficult to track the full scale of deception on X, the site formerly known as Twitter, social media researchers told Reuters.

;

;Researchers studying the origins and proliferation of misinformation said they have lost the ability to automatically track keywords, hashtags and other information about real-time events, as X eliminated access to a data tool that was free to academics before Musk's acquisition of the platform in October last year.

;

;Without the tool, researchers now need to manually analyze thousands of links, said Ruslan Trad, a resident fellow at the Atlantic Council's Digital Forensic Research Lab (DFRLab).

;

;Asked for comment, an X representative said more than 500 unique Community Notes, a feature that lets users add context to potentially misleading content, have been posted about the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

;

;In a post on the social media platform on Monday, X said it removed newly created accounts affiliated with the Islamist group Hamas and had "actioned tens of thousands of posts for sharing graphic media, violent speech, and hateful conduct." X did not disclose the actions it took on the posts, which can be removed or have their distribution reduced by the company.

;

;One false claim that spread on X and Meta Platform's ;(META.O); Facebook showed a US government document ;edited to look like approval; for $8 billion in military funds to Israel, according to a report by the Reuters Fact Check team.

;

;A Meta spokesperson said a team of experts including Hebrew and Arabic speakers were monitoring the "rapidly evolving situation in real-time."

;

;Others include a ;falsely labeled video; purporting to be Hamas militants with a kidnapped child, and video from a concert by American singer Bruno Mars miscaptioned as footage from an Israeli music festival that was attacked by Hamas, according to Reuters Fact Check.

;

;In a ;surprise attack; on Saturday, Hamas gunmen rampaged through towns, taking captives and killing hundreds of people in the ;deadliest Palestinian militant attack; in Israel's history.

;

;While disinformation has spread on all major social media platforms including Facebook and TikTok, X appeared to be the most recent to draw scrutiny from regulators.

;

;On Tuesday, European Union Commissioner Thierry Breton warned Musk that X was spreading "illegal content and disinformation," according to a letter Breton posted on X. The EU is home to some of the strictest internet laws in the world which require platforms to fight fake content.

;

;Musk challenged Breton's post and responded "Please list the violations you allude to on X, so that the public can see them."

;

;Under Musk, X has allowed users to pay to verify their accounts and lets certain users earn a portion of ad sales under a revenue share program. The changes now offer paid accounts the incentive to spread provocative or false claims to rack up followers, said Renee DiResta, a research manager at Stanford Internet Observatory.

;

;"Some of these accounts (on X) appeared to have been set up recently to gain virality ... and spread popular misinformation about the war," said Jack Brewster, enterprise editor at Newsguard, which creates reliability ratings for news websites.

;

;Musk himself recommended that X users follow two accounts that had previously spread false claims for "real-time" updates on the conflict, the Washington Post reported. The billionaire owner of the platform posted the recommendation on Sunday and later deleted the post, according to the Washington Post.

;

;Misinformation appeared to be most prevalent on X, according to Brewster and Tamara Kharroub, deputy executive director at Arab Center Washington DC, a nonpartisan research center.

;

;False information has also spread on messaging app Telegram and short-form video app TikTok, said DFRLab's Trad.

;

;A Telegram spokesperson said the company does not have the "power to verify information." TikTok did not respond to request for comment.

;

;Social media platforms face the challenge of straddling a line between moderating content to protect users while allowing information to spread in real time, something that has also helped the news media and investigators track civilian deaths.

;

;Towing the line is difficult even when platforms plan months in advance for planned events like elections, said Solomon Messing, a professor at New York University's Center for Social Media and Politics who previously worked at Twitter and Facebook.

;

;"It's much more difficult when there's a surprise terrorist attack, particularly one with this much video footage," said Messing.

;

;Some Community Notes on X have appeared after misleading narratives were viewed by thousands of users, Kharroub said, making them less effective at correcting false information.

;

;X said in its post on Monday that Community Notes typically appear within minutes of content posting. The company said while it may be "incredibly difficult" to see certain content, it was in the public interest to see information in real time.

;

;A YouTube ;(GOOGL.O); spokesperson said some violent or graphic content may be allowed if it provides sufficient news or documentary value about the conflict, adding the company prohibits content that promotes violent organizations, including video filmed by Hamas. Like other online platforms, YouTube has moderation employees and technology to remove content that violates its rules.

;

;Snap ;(SNAP.N);, owner of messaging app Snapchat, said its map feature, which lets users view public posts from anywhere in the world, will remain available in the region with teams monitoring for misinformation and content that incites violence.
